problem_text:
Let G be a finite p-group admitting an automorphism α of prime order q with |CG(a)| ⩽ n.
 a) If p = q, then does G have a nilpotent subgroup of class at most 2 and index bounded by a function of n?
 b) If p ̸= q, then does G have a nilpotent subgroup of class bounded by a function of q and index bounded by a function of n (and, possibly, q)?
B. Hartley
answer:
a) Not necessarily (E. I. Khukhro, Math. Notes, 38 (1985), 867–870).
 b) Yes, it does (E. I. Khukhro, Math. USSR–Sb., 71, no. 1 (1992), 51–63).
